Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Credibility \Cred`i*bil"i*ty\ (kr[e^]d`[i^]*b[i^]l"[i^]*t[y^]), n. [Cf. F. cr['e]dibilit['e].] The quality of being credible; credibleness; as, the credibility of facts; the credibility of witnesses. [1913 Webster]
credibility n : the quality of being believable or trustworthy [syn: {credibleness}, {believability}] [ant: {incredibility}]
